title: As per your politics, debt ceiling plan is good or a ‘disaster’
description: While some of US Congress's most conservative members are not happy with the deal, business groups gave it a thumbs up.

title: Iran journalist faces trial over charges tied to Amini protests
description: Iranian reporter tried in a closed court on charges linked to her coverage of Mahsa Amini’s funeral.

title: Teenaged student charged with murder in deadly Guyana school fire
description: The 15-year-old is accused of starting a fire in a school dormitory, killing 19, after her cell phone was confiscated.

title: Kosovo-Serbia tension: History, latest flare-up and what’s next?
description: Clashes erupt between police and local Serbs in northern Kosovo after new ethnic Albanian mayors take office.

title: What does re-election of Erdogan mean for Turkey and the world?
description: Leader set to begin a third term after winning presidential run-off vote.

title: El Salvador ex-president sentenced to 14 years over gang talks
description: Mauricio Funes, who currently lives in Nicaragua, denies the charges and says 2012 truce was brokered by the church.

title: Libya court sentences 23 to death for ISIL campaign
description: Appeals court sentences 14 others to life in prison for campaign including beheading Egyptian Christians in 2015.

title: India files graft case against BAE Systems, Rolls-Royce
description: The 'criminal conspiracy' case is related to the procurement and licensed manufacturing of 123 advanced jet trainers.

title: Venezuela’s Maduro meets Lula in Brazil as relations improve
description: Nicolas Maduro makes first visit to Brazil in years as Venezuela sees better ties with region's left-wing leaders.

title: US debt ceiling deal: What’s in, what’s out of the bill
description: The Democratic president and Republican speaker are trying to win over lawmakers to the plan in time to avert a default.

title: Ukraine’s parliament approves sanctions against Russia ally Iran
description: Package imposes trade, financial and technology sanctions against Iran and stops Tehran from using Ukraine's airspace.

title: Fighting continues in Sudan as latest ceasefire close to expiring
description: War inflicts widespread destruction on residential areas in Khartoum and adjacent cities of Omdurman and North Khartoum.

title: Nigeria’s new President Bola Tinubu vows reset for ailing economy
description: Tinubu inherits economy riddled with huge debt from predecessor Buhari, whose protectionist policies spooked investors.

title: The adoption of sign language is a loud win for anti-capitalism
description: Its new status as a national language in South Africa follows a long struggle against forces putting profit over people.

title: Wildfire forces thousands of people to evacuate in eastern Canada
description: More than 16,000 people leave their homes as crews battle raging blaze near Halifax, Nova Scotia.

title: Shanghai records hottest day in May in 100 years
description: Temperature hits 36.7C in China's largest city as records fall across Southeast Asia and South Asia.

title: Lavrov in shock Kenya visit days after Ukraine FM trip to Africa
description: The visits come as global powers continue to tussle for influence on the continent of 1.3 billion people.

title: Saudi Arabia executes two Bahrainis accused of ‘terrorism’
description: Government did not specify the groups the men were associated with, but said they had been planning to launch attacks.

title: After Turkey election win, what problems does Erdogan face next?
description: Economic concerns and relations with the West lie at the top of Erdogan's agenda after Sunday's presidential win.

title: Palestinian Authority officer killed by Israeli forces in Jenin
description: Ashraf Mohammad Ameen Ibrahim, 37, dies from gunshot wounds after a raid by Israeli forces on the Jenin refugee camp.

title: Five key takeaways from Turkey’s pivotal election
description: Erdogan a political survivor, Kurds put off by nationalist rhetoric and other reflections.

title: Troubled Chelsea hire Mauricio Pochettino on two-year deal
description: The 51-year-old Argentinian is tasked with reviving Chelsea's fortunes after worst Premier League campaign since 1994.

title: ‘Hope never dies’: Venezuelan migrants disappear in Colombia
description: Human rights groups say the state is not doing enough to find hundreds of Venezuelans who have gone missing in Colombia.

title: Photos: Memories of Nakba inspire Palestinian artist’s work
description: Abed Abdi, 81, is a Palestinian visual artist who was expelled from Haifa in 1948 and returned three years later.

title: ‘Squandered goodwill’: How Buhari failed Nigeria a second time
description: From the economy to security, Buhari's legacy will be one of missteps and misdeeds, analysts say as he hands over power.

title: ICC leaders in Pakistan to secure cricket World Cup participation
description: After India declined to tour Pakistan for the Asia Cup, Pakistan says it won't play in the Cricket World Cup in India.

title: ‘Ultimate influencer’ Ronaldo’s mixed season in Saudi Arabia
description: Ronaldo ends his first season in Saudi football empty-handed but his move to Al Nassr had impacts on and off the pitch.

title: US Senator Lindsey Graham on Russia wanted list after war remarks
description: Russia's Investigative Committee says it is opening a criminal investigation into comments made by Republican senator.

title: NATO troops form security cordons in Kosovo as Serbs protest
description: Soldiers block off four town halls to keep back Serbs protesting against ethnic Albanian mayors taking office.

title: Uganda’s Museveni approves anti-LGBTQ law – parliament speaker
description: The new law, one of the world's strictest anti-LGBTQ laws, is in defiance of condemnations from international community.

title: Not just Ben-Gvir: A new Al-Aqsa provocation is building up
description: The Israeli minister's visits have deep roots in religious Zionism. But his approach is now finding new takers too.

title: How did Turks living abroad vote in Turkey’s run-off election?
description: Erdogan received 59.4 percent of international votes, while Kilicdaroglu managed to garner 40.6 percent.

title: Lira hits record low, but stocks rise after Erdogan win in Turkey
description: The Turkish leader won the presidency for a third time after a run-off vote on Sunday.

title: Tinubu sworn in as Nigeria’s president, succeeds Buhari
description: Tinubu is Nigeria's fifth president since the return of democracy in 1999.

title: Everest continues to attract climbers 70 years after first summit
description: Nepal's mountains captivate both adventurers and tourists and bring a vital lifeline to surrounding villages.

title: Spanish PM Pedro Sanchez calls early election for July 23
description: Prime minister says he will dissolve Spain's parliament after his party performed poorly in local and regional polls.

title: History Illustrated: Wagner and the Rise of a Russian Mercenary
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin is a former convict and self-made oligarch who some now see as gunning for President Putin’s job.

title: Carmakers emitting 74 million tonnes of CO2, Greenpeace says
description: Top automakers' dependence on steel steering planet towards 'climate catastrophe', environmental group says.

title: Japan’s Nikkei hits 33-year high on weak yen, US optimism
description: Japanese stock market rises to the highest level since July 1990 after the US finalises deal to raise the debt ceiling.

title: PwC Australia stands down staff amid tax plans leak scandal
description: Accounting firm pledges to do 'everything it takes' to regain trust after leaking government information to clients.

title: China to send its first civilian astronaut into space
description: Payload expert Gui Haichao will set off for the Tiangong space station as part of a three-person mission on Tuesday.

title: Explosions as Russia launches 15th air assault on Kyiv in May
description: Overnight missile attack comes a day after Russia unleashed its largest ever drone assault on the Ukrainian capital.

title: Philippines’ crackdown on anonymous SIM cards prompts backlash
description: Some cybersecurity experts fear the SIM Card Registration Act will encourage identity theft and fraud.

title: Biden says final US debt ceiling deal ready for Congress vote
description: US president and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy are confident they will be able to get enough support to avert a default.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 460
description: As the war enters its 460th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Dozens killed in clashes with troops in northeastern India
description: New Delhi has deployed security forces to Manipur to try and put down ethnic unrest that began earlier this month.

title: North Korea plans ‘satellite’ launch in coming weeks: Japan
description: Pyongyang has said previously it completed work on a spy satellite, but Tokyo says launch could be ballistic missile.
